Reviews.Title: “Great value property! Newly renovated!”
Reviews.Author: Cari S
Reviews.Content: Our rooms was clean, newly renovated and the beds are great! My favorite parts are: the A/C was COLD and the front desk staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The bar was also a nice part of this property. Breakfast was hot and good each day. The hotel is on the edge of the quarter - but not a far walk at all from everything. For the price we will use this hotel again. We stayed at the hotel during a BUSY festival weekend and we enjoyed a quite sleep each night! The hotel has thick walls so we did not hear anything! We will be back!!! This is a very nice BEST WESTERN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: landersonic
Reviews.Content: Clean, pleasant room. Nice breakfast, internet area, and bar. Within walking district of Bourbon Street and all the delights of the french quarter. A little on the expensive side but it was Mardi Gras and a late booking. One complaint: With our booking we were told rollaway beds were available as there were 5 of us for Mardi Gras. When we got there it seemed that wasn't the case (supposedly due to a limit of 4 guests per room for fire safety reasons)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: PDXAJ
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, newly decorated with comfortable beds. The staff was very helpful when asked for advice on restaurants, tours, directions etc Breakfast was served buffet style each morning in a lovely dining room overlooking the pool. Having secure parking available was definitely a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bartender! Great Staff! Perfect Fit!”
Reviews.Author: JeunesseP
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of us in our party. Gina handled the group booking and treated us like royalty! Started each day with a wonderful breakfast (included) and enjoyed the pool more than words can say! The rooms were well taken care of and the staff greeted us like we were all old friends! Ty, the bartender took special care of us all and it didn't hurt that he's gorgeous! I would stay here again for any reason on any occasion. Well done! I know what it means to miss New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Best western may not have the best”
Reviews.Author: Fonda B
Reviews.Content: My first impression was "this isn't the impression that the Internet lead me to believe" I was grateful for the parking that was available, this is a rare amenity in the French Quarters. The location is right across the street from the Louie Armstrong park (beware at night), and probably a 10 minute walk from the main attractions n the heart of the quarters. There is a quaint bar in the lobby but never did get around to using it. The front dek was busy and a bit flustered but overall satisfactory. The room was suppose to a courtyard view turned into a view of the inner dark hallway. No view of anything but the hallway walls. The interior was kinda dark and outdated for my taste but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “"One Of The Best Hotels In The French Quarter"”
Reviews.Author: vern4ever58
Reviews.Content: we celebrated our 7th year wedding anniversary .......On The edge of the french quarter with the beautiful Louis Armstrong Park Right across the street with some strong History in arms reach was perfect. A short walk to bourbon street , french Market place, Shopping, Food etc..... The room was nice and the free breakfast was a great way to start off a busy day, the hotel staff was friendly but one that stood out was Mrs. Tracy Robinson, who went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful......The hotel was quiet and peaceful which you will need after a day and night in the french quarters..... I would recommend this hotel to family, friends and you.... When and If I return I will be staying here.... Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great price”
Reviews.Author: LTT789
Reviews.Content: Had a great time during the Essence Music Festival (Fourth of July weekend). Hotel is not directly on Bourbon street, but that's the good thing. It's about a 5 minute walk (probably less, but it was hot down there so we walked slow) from all the action on Bourbon Street, but you get peace and quiet when you want it. From check in hotel was very accommodating. When we booked we were told all rooms with 2 double beds were sold out, but when we checked in we were able to get just what we wanted. Rooms are a good size and clean. Pool/garden area is cute and clean. AND there was free hot breakfast! Make your own waffles, eggs, sausage, bagels, yogurt, fruits, cereal, home fries, oatmeal, etcâ€¦ not the best food, but decent. Front desk staff helped us set up swamp tour and steamboat ride. Also had a bar that looked nice, I didnâ€™t personally use it, but saw several patrons there on different occasions. Happy with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Medium experience.....”
Reviews.Author: MariJoCo
Reviews.Content: We have reserved for a 4 day stay at the Best Western Plus French Quarter, from July 25th to july 29th. The room was clean but the air conditionning doesn't cool down the entire room.... we had to request 68F to be comfortable but it still wasn't cold enough. The outside temperature is around 100F it takes something really efficient to cool down the room, what the hotel doesn't seem to have. Another thing, the most disturbing one.... we paid upon arrival for a parking pass for our entire stay. The last night, we came back at the hotel at 6pm to find out that the gates were closed.... the clerck told us, as if it was normal, that the first arrived is the first served!!!! They overbook there parking!!! The best thing he can propose us.... park on the street or go 7 blocks away in a public parking....we will refund you your 20$. What a service! I am sure we were there before a lot of new customers arriving on saturday for the week-end! We will certainly not recommand this hotel to anybody that needs a parking....

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: DebBF
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, updated and modern. Great breakfast buffet. Quiet, walking distance to whole French Quarter. Friendly, helpful staff. Pool was nice. Wish it had a restaurant though. Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting much for the price we got compared to other places in area. The staff was very friendly and room was very clean and up to date. The breakfast was ok and nice to have available for the good price we paid for the room. The parking spots are too small and expect to get dings on your car if you park there. Was blocked in one morning and told front desk and they beat me back to my car and quickly moved the valet car. Can't say enough about the friendly staff that we talked with during our week visit. Worth the price for the stay for sure. We have stayed and more expensive hotels in area and got less. Worth a stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay on edge of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: okwynnsome
Reviews.Content: Travelling through New Orleans with children, we wanted to get the feel of the French Quarter without exposing the kids to EVERYTHING the French Quarter offers. The location of this hotel, just on the edge of the Quarter was perfect. We were within walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go, but once we were ready for bed, we were far enough away from the noise and busy-ness to get some sleep. The rooms were clean, the lobby and bar charming. Didn't like the up-front $120 "incidental fee", but I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: ErnieKitchen
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a more convenient place for our adventures in NO. If you are interested in the French Quarter, everything is within walking distance. From the coffee shops of Decatuar to the bars of Bourbon. The bed was super, and we were able to keep the room dark and cool for afternoon naps. The little courtyard with its pool and fountain are a great place to start your morning with a breakfast or evening with a drink from the hotel bar. And thanks to Johnny for the great pizza recommendation!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Charm”
Reviews.Author: DebDaveLuke
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a lot of charm...the rooms were a bit dark for my taste, but they were very nicely done. We had just gotten off the ship from a cruise and I expected to just check my luggage at the desk since it was only 10 am, but they had a room ready for us, that was a very nice surprise. Their breakfast was also very tasty. Bourbon St isn't far away, but there were no restaurants close by and no room service. We were very tired and opted for sandwiches from the deli around the corner...that were very good. The a/c was a little noisy...that's about the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: LRC1957
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New Orleans and wanted to spend the night in the French Quarter that we could afford. this hotel was only 3 blocks from Bourbon Street. We smelled gas in the lobby and found out it was from the gas lanterns; you do not smell it in the room. The staff was very friendly. Rooms are very clean. Beds were clean with no sign of bugs (husband is in pest control and looked for signs). Breakfast is complimentary and is very nice. We took our plates and ate outside in the courtyard. I wish we had more time. Down fall - you must pay additional $22.40 (fee plus tax) to park.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: devonlewis
Reviews.Content: For the price you're paying-- this hotel has a good value. They offer free wi-fi and complimentary breakfast (which includes hot food items, such as eggs, sausage, breakfast potatoes) in the morning. Their bar is under utilized, as the servers "pour hard" and allow you to get take your drinks to the pool area-- a nice quiet evening activity. Our room was reflective of the professional pictues (although those are of the updated rooms, and our head board was not like that). Although we did not have a court yard room, like other travelers encourage readers to get, our room overlooked the street and Louis Armstrong park, which is beautiful! In the evening the fountain lit up, and the street noise wasn't abnoxious for me (and I'm a light sleeper). The parking fees are not as outrageous as other hotels charge; I called about 6 hotels in the area, and this was, by far, the cheapest parking. The front desk staff were cordial and helpful. The location is what is best here-- if you want to be able to have peace and quiet, but be close to everything, this is the place for you! It's about a 3 minute walk to Borboun Street, and a 5 minute walk to Canal Street (although it is on the opposite end to the popular River Walk). It's about a 5 minute drive to the 9th Ward, which we explored to see the devestation of Hurricane Katrina. If you don't mind walking, you do not need a vehicle to stay in this area! It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just back yesterday. From a 5 night stay in New Orleans and we were very pleased with this small very clean Hotel. The parking was a tad bit tight but it that way everywhere down there, the staff were very help full the room was small but very clean and quiet. All and all this Hotel is a great value and a great place to stay to me you just beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: UncleGonzo
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here one night on a road trip. The staff was friendly and responded quickly when I called them at midnight to tell them that the alarm clock in the empty room next to ours was blaring. The room was clean and comfortable. The pool was clean if a little small, and the courtyard area was nice. We were about a 10 to 15 minute walk from Jackson Square. The hotel is right across the street from Armstrong Park. I would stay here again if visiting the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Management ripped us off”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: When my friends and I looked for overnight stays in New Orleans during this years's Jazz festival we were in desperate need for accomodation as we decided to go on the trip last minute. When we explained the management that we needed to stay on a budget as low as possible, preferring to share one room instead of booking two, they deliberately misunderstood us, charging us the room rate for two instead of one. We immediatly realized the mistake and asked to rectify it. The management was then totally unhelpful, refused to rectify and called the police. The police sided with the management, which should not even have been an issue at all right from the start. Any serious and well-led hotel should allow the customers to rectify a booking, particularly since we hadn't even entered the rooms. Do not stay there if you are looking for an honest management and good service!!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JHM13
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before arriving and wasn't sure what to expect, but hoped for the best, and I have to say was pleasantly surprised. I was there with my 17 year old daughter, and even she really liked it. The pictures are accurate - the pool is in a lovely courtyard, and our room overlooked the courtyard. Rooms were a perfect size for us, floor to ceiling tile in the shower and frameless shower doors. Rich chocolate walls and really nice attention to detail. No cheesy pastel prints from the '80's. I had asked for a room that was quiet since we didn't stay out til 3am, and they were very accommodating. The whole staff was so pleasant and took care of any detail (our towel rack fell off and it was fixed immediately). Their breakfast was perfect since we planned on big lunches and dinners in the French Quarter (check out my reviews on restaurants NOLA's a big yes, and Cafe Pontalbo!). Just know when they say it ends at 9:30 they mean it. The breakfast area was in a garden room that overlooked the pool and courtyard. There is a beautiful park across the street with a lighted fountain, and great for a morning walk or run. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful with tips about walking around and places to eat. We both felt very comfortable walking around and stayed on St Ann when walking to the hotel at night. Honestly the only people we had to worry about were the drunken visitors. We were sure to get off the street by 11. I have to say this place was perfect for us. We were right at the edge of the French Quarter, so we were close to enough to be able to walk to all the good great things it has to offer (including the Aquarium) but we were away from the partying. LOVE the music and all the fun, but when we wanted to sleep and recharge, that's exactly what we did. One tip about the French Quarter if you've never been - this is not Disney's Epcot - yes the town is old, but that's what makes it so incredibly charming. Enjoy the architecture, art, music, food and locals!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: steve_e_hewitt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June 2012 and had a Queen room upstairs. The room was clean and well furnished with fridge and microwave. The hotel is set around a beautiful courtyard with a small swimming pool. We relaxed there with a few beers which were market price against New Orleans $4 a bottle. We had to pay $20 for parking which rises to $30 at weekends. This is the case for all New Orleans hotels as space is at premium. They let us leave the car there all day after we checked out so we did get our money's worth. I booked via Hotels.com and if I wanted to stay on they would match the price even on a Friday when prices go up by 50%. New Orleans works on a number of levels, go to Bourbon St and get off your face drunk as we saw with batchelor and batchelorette parties, be there as a tourist, The Jazz Legends Park and listen to Jazz and eat Cajun food or see it as a beautiful city with architecture, history and endless photo opportunities. Whatever you go for it is a unique place but as you would expect full of tourists like you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Travelhound0317
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well maintained. Our room was in the courtyard area on the second floor. Late at night/early morning it became quite loud, due to the people walking up and down the wrought iron stairs. The pillows on the bed were very small and the airconditioner kept going on and off all night, luckily we are heavy sleepers. The breakfast was more than your usual continental breakfast including eggs, bacon, sausage and biscuits. When I booked this hotel I was concerned with location. While it is close to the French Quarter, is does become a lot of walking when you are in the heat all day and then want to go back to the hotel to freshen up. Walking to the French Quarter or Frenchmen St where the authentic jazz clubs are gets to be a bit tiresome and by the end of the trip we ended up taking taxis. If you want to be close to Bourbon St, this is the hotel for you. If you want to be close to French Market, Royal St or Frenchmen St, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here under any circumstances”
Reviews.Author: SJHenderson
Reviews.Content: I tried to stay at this hotel with a number of friends a few weeks ago during my first visit to New Orleans. As an non-US citizen I had long looked forward to visiting to the South and New Orleans, it has always been a dream of mine. Due to a miscommunication the reservation was incorrectly recorded as two rooms with King-sized beds. Realising the error straight away we tried to return the rooms, but management was stubborn and refused to do so. They refused to acknowledge the misunderstanding, instead blaming us. The manager demanded a cancellation fee which was one nights stay. We hadn't even left the reception desk to even see the room. The police were called to deal with the dispute, however they said they would do it in the "New Orleans Way," which meant refusing to listen to us and siding with management. It was clear that they were good friends and the police officers were not willing to listen to us. Do not stay here. Management at this hotel has a lot to learn about customer service. Thankfully 'Southern style service' still exists - but not at this hotel. Go to the Sheraton you will have a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel run by terrible people”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: My friends and I attempted to stay at this hotel a few weeks ago. Due to some mis-communication, our reservation was incorrectly recorded as two rooms with King-sized beds (rather than one room with two Queen beds). As soon as we recognized the error, and before even entering the rooms, we tried to rectify the mistake with management. However, instead of taking care of the misunderstanding and changing the reservation, the manager demanded a cancellation fee equivalent to one night's stay. When we objected she called the police to "mediate" the dispute. When the police arrived it was clear that they were familiar with her. The officers told us they would settle the disagreement the "New Orleans Way," which consisted of them telling us to pay the cancellation fee without hearing any reasons to the contrary. (Where I come from we call this, "corruption.") The experience soured us on New Orleans. I would not recommend anyone stay here, ever. The manager deserves to be fired and the police officers should be brought up on charges of misconduct. Walk up the street to the Sheraton or the Marriott. Don't waste your time with this terrible hotel run by terrible people.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: masmanatee
Reviews.Content: So conveniently located 3 blocks from Bourbon St ..few blocks to Jackson Square and the French Market. Room was good comfortable bed ..small but space in New Orleans is at a premium. Had everything you could need. Room was clean and kept up (paint etc) All staff we encountered went out of their way to help and do things that you knew were not their jobs. Pleasant friendly except for the Front desk people who were less than enthusiastic not rude but not welcoming. One word answer to questions which it seems they would prefer not to answer. Breakfast was good not Waldorf quality but certainly something for everyone. Only problem was the bar doesn't stay open at night. Came back to sit in the courtyard and have a drink and it was closed at 8:30 on Sat or Sun nite. Pool was great and the courtyard was co cute and quaint and a great place to enjoy. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost, walls are paper thin.”
Reviews.Author: KrystaSch
Reviews.Content: Stayed there based on a special deal during the French Quarter Festival. This hotel showed up as a special deal on Hotels.com, and was $50 a night less than the JW Marriott where I already had a reservation. Wanting to save a little cash, I booked it and let go of my Marriott res. What a terrible mistake. I would happily have paid $50 more per night to have actually gotten quality sleep!! The doors to all of the rooms are outside facing, without any sort of noise blockage at all. We were woken up the first night sometime around 3AM by a drunken fight in the parking lot below our second level room. It was so loud and clear that I practically woke up swinging, because I swore someone was actually IN OUR ROOM. The next morning we were awoken by our lovely neighbor next door who was standing outside her room smoking and calling out to people in the parking lot, laughing and having a grand time. At 6 am. The following morning, we greeted the day with an extremely loud french conversation outside our door. Again, so loud that we woke thinking we were not alone in our room. The walls were so thin, I could regularly hear neighbors on both sides having normal conversations. I don't ask for much from a New Orleans hotel, just a nice clean bed to rest in so that I can recharge for another day / evening of revelry. And I do understand that it is a party town, and that you're likely to experience people acting like fools at all hours. However, the hotel needs their sound dampening to be seriously upgraded. At the very least, they need to post signs reminding guests to keep their voices down when standing outside someone's room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, however....”
Reviews.Author: pennyante05
Reviews.Content: Was a very nice, clean hotel. Location was great, only three blocks from Bourbon St. I arrived a few minutes after continental breakfast was to be over and the employee was very helpful about making sure I got something to eat. However, the front desk staff gave the impression we were bothering them when checking in or asking for information. The reason I gave the hotel only an average rating was because of the parking situation and the front desk staff response to it. Charge for parking is $20/day. As we were taking our car out of the garage to do some siteseeing we noticed that most of the parking spots were filled. We asked an employee what would happen if there were no available spaces when we returned. He said they would take our keys and double park our car. When we returned, the gates to the garage were closed. I went into the front desk and asked what we should do. He told me I could park in a lot 9 blocks away or since it was Friday, wait an hour until 6:00 pm and meter parking on the street would be free until Monday morning. I told him I was told they would take my keys and double park and he said there was no room. His attitude was it was my problem and he could care less. When I said I paid $20 to park he punched some keys on the computer and said he removed the fee. No apology, no sympathy, only kept saying I could park 9 blocks away or on the street. We were lucky to find a meter a block away although I wasn't crazy about leaving my car on an unsecured street. Also, what if it wasn't a Friday? Would I have had to run out to the meter every hour. Why don't they have some sort of deal with the lot 9 blocks away where they could take our car there.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Let Down”
Reviews.Author: Dawn388
Reviews.Content: I booked our accommodation in December 2011 for April 2012. You would have thought I would have gotten what I asked for (2 rooms side by side). When we arrived we were told we would not be on the same floor as someone who had just fronted at reception was given one of our rooms. I protested and they relented but our rooms were not side by side but quite a distance from each other. This was not good enough. The rooms themselves were nice and the hotel very good. Did have a problem with other guests walking past our door in the early morning and talking rather loudly - enough to wake us up. Also the car park directly underneath the rooms was not good. Motorbikes revving early morning is bad. Good to have computers available to guests. Breakfast was a definite bonus, with alot of variation. Would we stay again - maybe, but would look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Wosrt trip of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Chris E
Reviews.Content: This just happened! Share it! I recently booked a flight and stay through Expedia wit a Airline ticket for Delta & Hotel in New Orleans from Portland Oregon for April 12th and would leave @ 5 for my flight back home to Oregon. This was a once in a life time event for me to see my daughters Jazz Band from Independence Oregon perform at the Jazz festival in the French Quarter. When I arrived I asked to have a wake up call at 5am Sunday morning to catch a 7am flight home. Friday night I stepped on a staple and cut my big toe see picture of staple and blood. From 1 till 3:30 in the morning (the 14th) it sounded like someone was dragging a large metal garbage receptacle through the parking lot under my room. I them realized the PLUS in BESTWESTERN French Quarter didnâ€™t mean anything at all! I thought when I booked it and saw the hotel it would be a quite in, NOT! Fist thing Friday night I step on a staple in the carpet @ Hotel. From 2 till 4 in the morning it sounded like a giant metal garbage bin was being dragged across the down stairs parking lot. At 5:10 in the morning of the 14th three big burly and scary looking men came right into my room. I started screaming at them hoping I wasnâ€™t being robbed or something! They told me to shut up and be still! They finally turned on the light and realized they were in the wrong room! The next morning I made my complaint about the noise, my foot and the men in my room. The lady MGR had no empathy at all, I was disgusted with her reply. Saturday I was totally beat all day after the ordeal of the three men. I still canâ€™t sleep thinking about it. I was able to see daughter perform, but when see asked me to dinner I could only stay for a short time and was feeling sick to my stomach and did not enjoy our dinner together. I slept like a log Saturday night. @ 5 am I didnâ€™t receive any wake up call! I woke up @ 5 minutes till 7 and missed my flight had to run out and catch a cab to air port! No shower no food! So I had to go on 2 hours stand by from New Orleans to Atlanta, then 5 hours stand by to Oregon. Very bad vacation, worst I have ever had! I finally arrived in Oregon around 7:30 8ish. When I arrived I had no Baggage another problem! Did not get bag until the next night. After many days working with Expedia, I have decided to never use them again. I had to call them and be on the phone while they called the MGR and made me stay on the phone, in order to get my room refund of $529 for 2 nights there. I found out later the going rate was $150 a nite, so I was also WAY OVER charged for the room. Still waiting to get my whole trip refunded. Can't afford an attorney, any free ones out there?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: karatepunk816
Reviews.Content: the room was very nice and spacious. the staff very helpful. hotel was very clean. good selection at breakfast. only complaint is if you are arriving late, you will be parking in a lot down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: LeeBee13
Reviews.Content: Room large and very clean but being by the elevator it was a bit noisey. Not all rooms are the same in size. Our friends had a nicely appointed room but it was a good bit smaller. You might want to ask about that. We had to turn the air down to 63 to get any kind of cooling but other then that we were well satisfied with our room and the price was right. We could walk to Boubon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: takemehigher
Reviews.Content: Had a two night stay at this hotel over French Quarter Fest. Hotel has a wonderful courtyard and my first room overlooked it. The room was perfect - pristine, newly done and ideal. But no tub and this trip, I needed to soak. So I asked for a room with a tub and got one. Still very clean and nice but with some kind of air odor - like an air-conditioning mildew smell. But had a tub so I settled. Wasn't in the room that much and got used to the smell - just that first impression. Staff was tops - helpful and very friendly. Breakfast was standard - good except for those fake eggs everyone seems to use but the biscuits were terrific - lots of good coffee, juice and yogurt. And this hotel has a small bar for socializing. Plus the courtyard and pool are draws also. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Also not far from the Quarter or Bourbon St.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price - bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: fern12345
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great location - close walk to the good parts of French Quarter, Canal St and the trolley cars, and Frenchmen district. - Clean, well-equipped rooms. A bit small, but you didn't come to NOLA to live in your room! - Nice courtyard, with a pool, Cons - If you live on the courtyard side, it can get loud at night, with people talking loudly as they return home. - Breakfast: when we were here, they had fox news on in the main room. no one was watching it, but it just gave you this feel of a nice family dinner where uncle ted just can't keep his political views out of the pleasant family conversation. The food was disgusting (esp after eating in NOLA for 4 days) with runny eggs and "potatoes" and "sausage" which someone put a lot of effort into making taste worse than McDonald's.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: BrakeForMoose
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location and accomodations. Our room opened up into the courtyard area which was very nice. We had a rental car which we were able to park in a secure, covered location in the hotel garage for about $20/day. Everything was within walking distance so we didn't even need the car until our next vacation spot. We were able to go back and forth through the French Quarter throughout the day which was great. Friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Faylou
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Short walk to Bourbon Street and Riverwalk. I was surprised at how easy it is to get around New Orleans. No need for a car, just walk or catch public transport. We stayed in room 220 which overlooked the pool area, it was a bit on the smaller side of most of the Best Westerns I have stayed in but still had a very comfortable stay. Pros - Great breakfast - Lovely pool area and garden - Friendly and helpful staff - Double shower - Very comfy pillow top beds - Nice decor in rooms and hotel - Close to Bourbon Street Cons - Walls are a little thin (take earplugs) - If you get a pool view room it can be a little noisy if there are a lot of people in pool area - We couldn't open the window for fresh air I would definitely stay here again, maybe just not a pool view room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to French Quarter and bus lines”
Reviews.Author: Travellover789
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small, it was beautifully decorated. Some of the rooms surround a nicely landscaped courtyard and pool. Our room was away from that area which was great because it can be noisy in that section. Parking is limited - not enough spaces for all rooms, so if you are driving, get there around check out time so you will get a spot. You can leave your luggage in the car, take a walk, go to lunch and then come back later to check in. The parking area is well lit and gated at night and you are charged for parking. There is a safe in the room, which you will be charged for. Free breakfast had a lot to choose from. Free wifi but they should have told us they were going to change the password mid-week.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: thewashingtonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of January and were pleased with the room. For the French Quarter the price is fair, rooms were updated, and the breakfast was great. Hotel staff was very friendly and after many stays in the Quarter that is hard to fine in the mid range chain hotels here. It's on the outskirts of the quarter but in a matter of minutes we were on Bourbon and had no problem walking to Jackson Square or Canal Street. It's not the quietest hotel mainly because if you're in the quarter on a weekend you will run into bus loads of college kids at these types of hotels or Convention people that like to hit it hard while in town. Stick to the nicer hotels if peace and quiet are really important to you. I would recommend this hotel and stay again for the price I got.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Monster_1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a couple blocks off Boubon Street and is easy to walk to. Stayed there for one night to catch a Saints-Bears game and wasn't in the hotel much. No major complaints but the room we were in had a musty smell to it and the rooms are decorated to be very dark which made it feel dated for some reason. Beds were comfortable. Overall the hotel was nice for the night, maybe a weekend but no more than that for me. I should say that friends I was with got a room in the building were reception is and the room was nicer (no smell and not dark). If you got lucky to get one of those rooms it would be a good place for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room; location and competent service!”
Reviews.Author: Jonagold4
Reviews.Content: Only stayed two nights and switched to another more central FQ location where the service was more personable, rather than BW professional; but, room not as well designed for comfort. Never left hungry from breakfast. Enjoyed the free lobby computers and USA Today and it was very quiet. I was next to last stop on the van shuttle from the airport; but, got a tour of Warehouse District, Canal Street and FQ hotels. Was there the week before Mardi Gras.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, amenities and price”
Reviews.Author: Reg J
Reviews.Content: Situated at the top of the quarter and the middle. Short walk to Bourbon St or market. Great way to walk through the quarter different ways as you explore. Staff, room and facilities very good. Breakfast very good with eggs & meats - can eat in central courtyard by pool. Feels old days good.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat! Very Charming!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTreehugger
Reviews.Content: WOW did we have a good time in NOLA. It was our first time to visit this incredible city and our experience was a true delight. From the moment we walked in the door of this hotel, we felt at home. The staff was incredible. Glenn and Robert checked us in and acknowledged our 25th wedding anniversary with an upgrade. Our room (suite) was absolutely lovely, the courtyard is beautiful, the breakfast room, bar area and lobby are quaint. All of the staff at this hotel were pleasant, thoughtful and accommodating We just can't say enough good things about how we were treated and how genuinely nice and sincere everyone was. This hotel should be commended for their superior hospitality, they sure won us over. Room was quiet, breakfast was fine, just a few short blocks to Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ladybird2007
Reviews.Content: I went to NOLA with a friend and we got a double beds room. I disagree with other comments : our room was very big !!! It is a bit noisy but if you want to be in town you will have noise anyway. Very good location : all the French Quarter can be done walking from the hotel. Very good and complete breakfast. It was a little bit cold to enjoy the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeff1948
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline for $81 a night (rack rate was $119 on weekdays and $159 on weekends) and we were delighted to find that it was a very comfortable, quiet, clean, and well-run establishment. The location is great: right on the border of the French Quarter across the street from Armstrong Park, so it is close to everything in the Quarter but very tranquil at night. There is a large courtyard in the interior of the three-story hotel where you can relax on lounge chairs or sit at little tables. A continental breakfast is included: waffles, eggs, sides, cereals, oatmeal, bagels, pastry, juices, coffee, etc. Weâ€™d definitely stay here again. Request a room overlooking the fountain courtyard; rooms in front get noise from N. Rampart Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality in great city”
Reviews.Author: Joanna F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in NOLA and took taxi to this hotel from the airport (flat rate $33 for two - better deal than taking airport shuttle!) and hotel was very easy to access. Check in was a breeze, the front desk offered a map to get us started in exploring. Hotel is close enough to action (about 5 min walk to the heart of French Quarter) but not too close that we couldn't sleep at night with the noise, etc. Room was very clean, we got the courtyard view which was pretty with outdoor swimming pool, fountain and seating area. We stayed for 6 nights and found that the hotel met everything that we needed. Pretty decent breakfast with eggs, biscuit, sausage/bacon, plus other things. After 3 days of having breakfast at the hotel, we decided to skip and went out to different cafes in the area, but free breakfast is always a plus. There were a few incidents of people smoking right outside our door, in the elevator and in the hallway. Not the hotel's fault at all. I called the front desk and they took care of it immediately. Check out was easy also and they have a business center that you can use to print boarding pass. All in all, very good experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not great.....Great time, but not because of the room!”
Reviews.Author: BamaWinsBCS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the BCS National Championship, Jan 2012. Room rates skyrocketed due to demand and we paid way more than this hotel was worth. But, we knew that was probably going to be the case with any hotel in NOLA during such a busy weekend. We woke up to a dripping sound and thought it was just a faucet but discovered that there was a leak from the floor above coming down through a recessed light fixture in to our sink. Seemed pretty darn dangerous to us; the maintenance staff came in and looked, but never returned. When we asked about it the next day, they sent someone again, but he just said it was the toilet leaking from the room above us and he could not really do much. We stayed 3 nights and did not have hot water until the last morning.....tile floor in bathroom is slick as glass. I had to put towels on the floor of the shower to keep from slipping. We requested delayed maid service one morning and they never returned....when I asked the front desk to go ahead and service the room, they replied that maids had already gone and they simply offered us clean towels. Obviously, this is not a full service operation. Given a choice, I would not return. If it was my only choice, I would stay there knowing that it was about all I could find. The one redeeming factor was that the bed was comfortable and the room was as clean as could be expected for an old property.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: soleilin
Reviews.Content: It might be a little far from the major attractions, but if you stop by somewhere else on the way, you won't feel it's far at all. It is convenient to us. The park across the street is nice (Armstrong). There is also a conveniences store and a laundry place nearby. It's not far from Bourbon street, so it's easy to get nice food. The breakfast of the hotel is very nice. It is an old hotel but it keeps the unique southern style quite well. The room is relatively smaller but it looks it was newly renovated. Overall, it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: GaryC54
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this hotel when planning a stay in the French Quarter this past week. Located on the fringe on the Quarter on Rampart St. Very pleasant, helpful, friendly staff allowed a somewhat early check-in and assisted with parking which was at a premium. Rooms were clean and very decent albeit a wee bit small. Very nice courtyard surrounding a pool and a very nice free breakfast which was complete and very tasty. I would recommend and stay here again in a minute. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: JRusty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week for Jazz Fest. Room appeared to have been updated and clean. I do agree with others that room was on the small side but I think the size would be ok for a couple. Courtyard was nice but very few loungers so several times during our stay there was none available. I didnt mind the free breakfast, I grabbed a bagel/cream cheese and tea every morning for free and it did save us some cash for the week. Free shuttle brought us to festival grounds everyday but on some days it was a long wait and we ended up getting a cab. The reason I would recommend passing on this place is I didnt care for the location and we did not get a great deal. Yes everything is within walking distance but why not stay in the heart of the french quarter with real NOLA charm for the same price? I know now after doing some research to book a trip back for Jazz Fest that we over paid to be in an "iffy" location. For less $ we just book an apartment with a balcony overlooking Bourban, people watching here I come! I am also looking forward to having a kitchen since our room at The Best West didnt have a mini fridge for yummy left overs or to keep beverages cold.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: ProFlyer66
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Best Westerns but this one takes the cake, it completely embellished the French Quarter look and feel by its natural charm and courtyard. For an older building we were surprised at how modern the accommodations were. The rooms were beautifully decorated with New Orleans artwork, the bath was gussied up with marble, granite and a spacious glass shower with rain nozzle. The bed and pillows were super comfortable and we enjoyed the 40" plasma tv. Breakfast in the morning was your typical waffle-eggs-sausage with selections of yogurt and breads and danish. There was construction in the courtyard but it wasn't loud from where our room was located. The location is less than a 10 minute walk to Bourbon street so for the money it was worth staying here. I do want to stay directly in the French Quarter next time but we were very pleased at the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: NeptuneHouston
Reviews.Content: We took a 3 day trip to New Orleans and wanted to stay close to the French Quarter without spending an arm and a leg. I mean how long are you going to be in the room anyway? The rooms were not huge, but they were clean and the beds were very comfortable. This is an old restored building which has lots of charm. The elevators are tiny and there is a nice courtyard with a pool and seating areas. (we were there in the winter) They offer a free continental breakfast, including eggs, sausage, biscuits and more. The bartender was friendly and very helpful with local attractions. They have free WI-FI and a small business center that makes it handy to print your boarding passes. The hotel is just a few blocks from Bourbon Street, and is far enough that you don't have to listen to all the noise. They do have an airport shuttle, BUT you must reserve it at least 24 hours in advance. If only the front desk had told us this little detail, we could have saved some money. I would stay here again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Leanne561
Reviews.Content: We loved this Hotel, it has everything, location, good size rooms, clean, bar, courtyard and great helpful staff. We especially liked Todd's margarita's, (The best in New Orleans!) Tracy at the front desk was also very helpful with finding a rental car company for us, and would recommend Nifty to anyone. The location is great close to the French Market, Jackson Square, all the attractions are within walking distance. Would also recommend Coops' Place for dinner, and the Fleur de Lis for Breakfast/Brunch. Thanks everyone at the Hotel for making us feel welcome in New Orleans:)) The free breakfast (while plain/simple) is also a bonus. Go to Frenchman street for the best Jazz Bands and the Apple Barrel pub, which also has a yummy Italian restaurant above, and you have to go to the Clover Grill for the best hamburgers in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: memorymaker
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but comfortable with everything we needed for our stay. There is a lovely courtyard with pool and ample seating. Free WIFI and breakfast with eggs, bacon, sausage, baked goods, fruit cups, fresh fruit, juices and decent coffee. The staff was friendly and helpful, gave good suggestions on what to see and do. A short walk put us right in the middle of all the action and revelry. The room was well priced for the area and parking was $20.00 per night. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Terry G
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, but it is in a restored landmark building, The room was comfortable, clean well appointed and the WIFI worked all the time. The free breakfast was not just a continental buffet, but had real eggs, sausage and bacon, as well as pastries and fresh fruit. The staff was extremely helpful with where to go and what to do. At the edge of the Franch Quarter and about a half mile walk to Bourbon St, but it was peaceful and quiet at night. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: MarieBJK
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, I agree with some of the downfalls. I can see how parking a large vehicle would be difficult but it's doable. They do lock the parking garage at night but when we arrived back late, there was a nice gentleman who opened the gate for us. The front desk service and housekeeping aren't great. We even tipped housekeeping and they still didn't leave us new soap and shampoo/conditioner. We called and they brought more up quickly. It's New Orleans and what I have learned going there is that sometimes with such a laid back culture you get too relaxed service. I would stay here again. It's close enough to walk but away from all the loudness that keeps you up at night if you are trying to sleep. The rooms were clean and nice enough. We didn't spend too much time lounging around in the room so it met our needs. It's better than paying $50 more a night for a room in the heart of the Quarter that is old and dirty and right in the middle of the late night..well all night yelling.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located on the edge of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Buzzhombre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is generally a good choice if you want to be near the French Quarter. It's on Rampart Street just across the street from Louis Armstrong Park (I was warned not to go in the park after dark). Three blocks to Bourbon Street, and about five blocks to Jackson Square and Cafe du Monde. The room was nice, with a table and chairs, as well as a work desk. It came fully equipped with coffee maker and fridge. My only complaint was the windows. Screws had been inserted to prevent one from opening the windows. I like fresh air, especially when sleeping, and their appeared to be no way to just run the fan on the A/C unit--you had to have heat or cold. In October, you need neither in New Orleans. I went to Rite-Aid and bought a $2 screwdriver and removed the screws. I put them back in before I left. They have a good breakfast with a large breakfast room next to the bar, but make sure you get there before 9:30. They start shutting everything down right at closing time--no wiggle room. The bar is open in the evening, but I never saw more than one or two people there--New Orleans has lots of bars, so no reason to go to the one at the hotel. There's a large pool in an interior courtyard, but I didn't try it. There were lots of Europeans (French and German) staying here. The price on Friday night was a bit high (over $150), but on weeknights it was a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: pharmland
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the evening to the French Quarter on August 19, 2011. I know that our health care corp authorizes the Best Weterns for our business travel. I approached the front desk where there were two employees behind the counter. One appeared to be front desk staff and the other a manager of some sort. The male who appeared to be the manager was seated eating fried chicken. I asked if they had any rooms for the night. The man who did not stop eating started talking to me through the other staff member without looking at me, as if I were rude enough to interrupt his chicken snack. So he says "yeah" to my inquiry into room availability to which the staff employee reiterates this affirmation to me as if I needed a tranlator. I asked what the rate was, again without looking at me I was quoted a rate well above the internet posted rate. I asked it they had a AAA rate, again without looking at me or stopping his snack the manager responded nastily as if speaking through his coworker "nope that's it". I said thank you and walked out. I walked around the area and quickly found a nice place to stay a few blocks down for ~$100/night. I understand that Best Westerns are indepently owned and I usually enjoy them. This experience was not just bad customer service; it was downright insulting. I am really an easy to please traveller. Stay anywhere else. The French Quarter has a myriad of nice places. This is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is the worst”
Reviews.Author: EddieC64
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying at this hotel because of the mediocre reviews but decide to anyway. Big mistake. We got a room with a king sized bed. The room was nicely decorated but the furniture is too big for the small room. Not much moving space. I noticed in the shower stall a plastic razor cover by the drain that was not removed from housekeeping decide to leave it there. The second day our room was not even made up. I called at 4:45 pm to the front desk and was told that housekeeping staff had left for the day and that the manager would be informed and get back to me. That never happened. I went to the front desk and told the female clerk with blond hair that my room was never made up and that I needed towels. She asked "how many" and gave me the towels with a curt response of "I'm sorry about that". Surprisingly enough there was a man before me asking for bathroom tissue because housekeeping didn't leave him any. The next day I reminded another front desk clerk that I wanted my room made up. She didn't even look at me and said "sure". When I got back to the room, my request to change the linen on the bed was never done, and the razor cover was still on the shower drain! I noticed during the day that housekeeping staff was always on their cell phones or chatting amongst themselves. Front staff and housekeeping staff need some kind of customer training because these people don't seem to care about their clients or their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use garage unless you have a small car”
Reviews.Author: Harleyrider2010
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and wanted a place in the French Quarter, The parking in the garage is extremely tight, so if you have a large or even a mid-size vehicle you might have problems. And it is first come first serve. We got a spot on the end, and the balcony was right above and people were throwing their trash off the balcony into the garbage bin which was on the end, and there was food, bags, etc all over the ground. Their elevator is very small. We left the card on the bed requesting that they change the sheets and had spoken to housekeeping, they did not change them. They just made the bed. No matter what the air conditioner was set at, it did not cool the room. Shower door kept sliding open, and website said each room had a ceiling fan, ours did not, they said during the remodeling that they had done, all of them were removed. And they mention about how close they are to bourbon street, but when you ask about getting there, they tell you not to go the shortest route because that is the hood and you could be mugged. So you have to go over 2-3 blocks, then go down to bourbon street. Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “All in all good”
Reviews.Author: Silvurbak
Reviews.Content: Apart from from the poor attitude from the afternoon check in clerk (long blonde hair, mole on chin) this was a great stay. Excellent value. Close enough, yet far enough from Bourbon street. Good breakfast, and beautifully re-finished rooms. I would stay here again. Don't let one miserable receptionist taint this hotel (alnost did for me), the others were excellent and made you feel welcome. Very clean. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Best Western EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob-Borth
Reviews.Content: Best Western should remove their affliation with this location. Room was so small, it was difficult to move around. In order to get past the bed and the wall at the end of the bed with your luggage, you literally had to walk side ways to get by. You had to shut the bathroom door to use the toilet or shower. I have a one car garage that was bigger than this room. And the room was NOT cheap!! Absolutely terrible!! Advice - find another location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. We will be back...hopefully soon.”
Reviews.Author: livbear02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a highly recommended hidden gem. Much better than expected. We felt very safe here, even with our two small children. Wonderful breakfast. Clean, clean, clean. Beautifully decorated rooms that resemble those in a much more expensive hotel. Thanks so much to all staff at the Best Western Landmark! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best place to stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SharonHL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently remodeled, and still in the middle of some construction during our stay. For the price, I was very impressed. The rooms are nicely updated and the hotel has a pretty courtyard. It is in a good location. If you are looking to stay in the French Quarter, and are looking for that "French Quarter style", but don't want to pay too much, this is it. The gentleman working the front desk was also very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a Girls Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Jcontenta
Reviews.Content: We stayed her with a group of 10 in March and loved it! Especially the court yard! So for a girls birthday weekend, 6 of us went back for a great and fun time!! I'm a very conscious traveller and felt incredibly safe while staying here. The free breakfast was fresh, warm and tasty! The rooms were clean and well maintained, though, I will say the stone work in the bathrooms consistantly do seem to have an odd odor. If you are looking to stay near canal street, this NOT the hotel for you. If you are wanting to be near Bourbon Street, this IS a great location! Look it up, you'd be near Lafitte's bar, Tropical Aisle, Cat's Meow, and many awesome places in between! Great place to stay and even better for the cost!!

Reviews.Title: “It's in the HOOD”
Reviews.Author: sdberri
Reviews.Content: The stafff was rude, especially the older african american manager I think his name was glenn. Parking was 30 a day and you are not guaranteed to have a parking space if the hotel is full they double park. so if you leave the hotel, you may have to park down the street when you get back. I smells like old mop water. If you want to stay somewhere that is not safe this is your place. you are not going to be close to any attractions such as canal street and bourbon. You will have to take a cab or walk over 2 miles. I hated my stay. The rooms are really small maybe enough room for a couple but not a group.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place on the northern fringe of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mesocyclone2011
Reviews.Content: This place is a real gem! Best Western does a great job managing this old building on the northern fringe of the French Quarter. The central courtyard is extremely pleasant and is much like those you would find in backyards elsewhere in the Quarter. Our newly-remodeled room was extremely comfortable, clean, and (surprisingly) well-decorated with nice furniture and bathroom fixtures. Staff members were very accommodating and helpful (they held our bags in their office for a good 8 or 9 hours after checkout). The location is fantastic--within easy walking distance of any destination in the French Quarter (and, for most people, even downtown NOLA), but it's far away from the rowdiness of Bourbon Street and thus easy to get a good, quiet night's sleep. The extremely efficient air conditioning is also a huge plus in this very humid city. I was initially concerned by a couple of recent reviews regarding bedbug activity, but we (after a quick search) found none and in fact found the entire room to be spotless. This place make our stay in New Orleans even better than it would have been otherwise. Note: room rates were extremely reasonably for our weekday stay, but rose dramatically for the weekend (granted, there was a festival going on). If you time it right, this place can offer truly fantastic deals...

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this Hotel to friends.”
Reviews.Author: BillJody2011
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by this Hotel. Located in the French Quarter it is easy walking distance to all the area. The outside of the hotel isn't spectacular but better than the surrounding buildings. The interior and our room in particular was among the best we have ever stayed at for a standard size room. Our room was very clean and the large shower was appreciated. The courtyard with the pool was nice. The free breakfast included sausage and eggs along with all the usual. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: stuman17
Reviews.Content: good location. All else average or below. Breakfast below average. Staff was friendly. They have parking onsite which is a big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: chutchi
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Things went well until Day 2 when I went to get on the elevator. A Manager and an employee were in there as well. When the door closed, the elevator didn't move. I asked why they allowed me in the elevator when they knew there was a problem. They claimed they didn't know there was a problem, which was completely incorrect as a few seconds later, the employees phone chirped with "try this...." I was trapped in this non-air conditioned elevator with them for about 15 minutes. Both my friend and I arranged for taxi's with the front desk the night before our departures. Neither of us had a taxi waiting for us at the pre-arranged time; creating some stress for catching our flights. Lastly, and the most troublesome, was that my friend has battled a bad case of bed bites caused by our stay. My email to management to inform them of this issue has not been responded to. Buyer beware.....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: Stefanie E
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. We went with two other couples for Memorial Day weekend and had a great time. The rooms were very nice and clean, we all had king rooms overlooking the courtyard and pool, which we requested. We enjoyed the pool both Saturday & Sunday afternoon because of the heat. The breakfast was decent and the bar was good. It's only a few blocks to Bourbon. We walked down St. Ann because it was more lite up than other streets and had more activity at night. If you walk down St. Ann, it will also take you all the way down to Jackson Square and Decatur. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: lwi
Reviews.Content: We have visited New Orleans 3 times and have stayed her every time. We like this place because it is in the Quarter but not right in the heart of it. They have parking for your car, but you can walk to anything in the French Quarter. The place was always nice but since our last visit they have remodeled the rooms and are very nice. They have breakfast downstairs every morning and a nice pool in the courtyard. Really the best deal in the French Quarter of New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for price but far from attractions”
Reviews.Author: Theo713
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and the remodel has been completed. My wife and I took a trip to get away and relax in the BIG EASY. Hotel front desk was very infomative about the area but do your homework there is TONS to see and do. Courtyard was very clean and pool was refreshing! This hotel is about 9 blocks from the river and we did LOTS of walking. Make sure you take this into account before booking because most of the tourist attractions were down at the river. Make sure to take a stroll over to Frenchman Street to see the best local Jazz clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, accommodations and service. A lovely place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: LoriBAndican
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Landmark Hotel was a great place to stay - the service and accommodations were outstanding. I was especially impressed with the helpfulness of the people at the front desk - they went out of their way numerous times to help us out - even to locate and return a beloved stuffed animal that had been left behind. I truly appreciate all they did for our group, and would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “remodeled doesn't mean bug free!”
Reviews.Author: SurfTaco27
Reviews.Content: We ventured to NOLA for a birthday party for one of our friends. When we booked our reservation we requested a King bed in a newly remodeled room and when we arrived, this wasn't an available option for us. We had the choice of two doubles/queens in a newly remodeled room or one king in an older room. I am a bit of a hotel snob so i opted for the two beds in the newly remodeled room. The room was decent, nicely decorated and very clean, but very small. The beds were a bit firm. I think when they updated those rooms, they skipped the bed upgrades. BW typically isn't on my radar when I travel so I'm not sure if that's the norm for them or not. We only chose this hotel because it was during the NCAA finals and all the hotel prices were through the roof! During our stay, my husband was grabbing something off the night table and a roach when running behind the bed. He quickly moved some other items on the table and a bunch of baby roaches scattered from the alarm clock! We called mgmt and i believe his name was Dave, he showed up almost instantly. I was very impressed! He was very apologetic about the situation. He took the alarm clock and it turns out there were many more little creatures to be found in there! He brought us a new one and santized our room. He was very helpful! The next day though we did see some more roaches in the closet. We mentioned this at our checkout and told them they may just want to get an exterminator in. They were so sincere and actually discounted our room rate and gave us free parking for the two nights that we were there. A very nice gesture. Overall a decent stay. As in any large city with outside hotel room access you're going to have a bunch of noise but our stay was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “$100 security deposit at check - in”
Reviews.Author: CatherinefromPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at this hotel and was not impressed. My biggest gripe is that they charged me for the room the day I booked it, then took another $100 out my debit card for a "security deposit". I travel often, and have never had a hotel do this. It was not disclosed verbally at check-in but is evidently on the paperwork. They have no amenities - and you have to walk a distance to get anything like toiletries, tylenol, etc. The neighborhood is in the outskirts of the FQ and is pretty scary.To get to Bourbon street you walk through sketchy areas and the "alternative" area of the French Quarter. Rooms were decent, but housekeeping does a minimal job cleaning at best. The hotel bar is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays and there is one vending machine in the garage where you can buy a water, coke, etc. I would not stay at this hotel in the future - and just pay more to stay in a better neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Away from noisy congested areas but close enough.”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeBarb10
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place with a warm and gracious staff. My husband & I were here with a number of other family members from all over for a wedding. The rooms are very comfortable, attractive and spotless. The courtyard and fountain with a nice pool is a great place to be outdoors. Continental breakfast had a great variety of choices and a pleasant dining room overlooking the courtyard. The bar area has lots of comfy chairs and tables and the bartender hosted our family gatherings graciously. We didn't drink much but had lots to talk about. We walked everyplace. At first it seemed a long way to the riverfront area, French Market, etc. compared to the area where most of the big hotels are, but it's just in a different direction. It is quiet and away from things but still convenient. I would deffinitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with character and great location”
Reviews.Author: busymomin2007
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because it the location. It is a really neat hotel in the French Quarter. The rooms are a little smaller than average, but normal for New Orleans. Everyone was nice, breakfast was really good. The only thing was the parking is very tight (typical for New Orleans also) and has a limited capacity which I didn't know about before I arrived. We really enjoyed our stay and would most definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: iantoes
Reviews.Content: The location was great overlooking Armstrong park right on the edge of the French Quarter. Our room overlooking the courtyard and pool was excellent and breakfast was fine. Not sure the bar should shut at 8pm on a Sunday but it did. My only gripe would be that we were charged for car parking, bearing in mind the hotel had its own car park it was not renting anywhere else. Paying for parking at a hotel really does my head in, we pay to stay at the hotel then get charged for the privilege of parking there its is quite frankly not on. Having said all that given the location and how much we loved New Orleans I would stay in the same place again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Davko79
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were warm and friendly - lovely. And the room really surprised and impressed me considering the rate we paid. Had a true French Quarter vibe to the room - spacious, comfortable, classical, with nice modern bathroom. Very clean, tidy and hospitable plus an extremely short and safe walk to the main area of French Quarter like Bourbon Street. Had a magical time, would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive ATM- No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye135
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed there last weekend. The ATM charged me $5 for a $60 withdrawl without informing me of the cost. Friday morning at 11:00a.m. the shower had no hot water but the sink did. Very strange!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: SubeeMoodyTexas
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The rooms in New Orleans are typically small, and these are as well compared to other Best Westerns, but my adult daughter, sister, and I were very comfortable in one room. The location is great. We felt safe at all times even on our short walks to the Quarter at night. We had one of the newly renovated rooms, and it was lovely...a real NO "feel" about it. The hotel is under construction, so if you plan to hang out in the lobby you might feel disappointed, but the breakfast area is pleasant, and on the night of our arrival, Dec. 11th, the staff and bartender were delightful They helped us map out our days, offered brilliant suggestions, and were funny. Unfortunately, the bar was closed the rest of the trip, but we got our money's worth that evening. On the 12th a terrible cold front blew in with gale force winds. We enjoyed the sleep-in day, and it was a quick walk around the corner to buy some craw fish cakes at a local market. If you are looking to stay in the lap of luxury, you might be disappointed, but if you want a very delightful room, helpful staff, and a good location this is a great place. We were on the third floor and the walk down to the lobby was quick and painless. We only used the elevator to check in and out. Being from Central Texas we discussed the fact that we might perhaps drive on our next visit, but parking is around $30 per day, so flying for us was less expensive, and we like to walk. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, but overall OK”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: parking is extra, French Quarter just around the corner, Breakfast was nothing special

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and updated rooms, but not a good location.”
Reviews.Author: cruisetraveler51
Reviews.Content: The frontline staff was wonderful and extremely helpful. However the noise in and around the hotel was horrendous. all hours of the night we heard loud music directly outside the hotel, loud construction type sounds all hours of the night. the air conditioning unit in the room and the refrigerator were having competition to see who could turn on and off the most. the hotel was very nice and the rooms look like they were recently updated. but the hotel was not in a very good location. after talking to many of the locals, even they were concerned with where we were staying. the area was considered not safe, especially at night!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: 1dervol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location just on the edge of the French Quarter. The hotel and ground are a mess because they're renovating but it really needs to be cleaned up. I asked for a renovated room and got one. It was on the backside of the hotel overlooking another courtyard. I was shocked when I went in from this very tacky looking balcony into the room. It was amazing! Dark brown walls, great new beds, very nice furniture, great bathroom! The shower had one of the huge heads and was a good size bathroom. Flat screen TV. Very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: NWTravellerSeattle
Reviews.Content: Location - on the edge of the French Quarter - easy to get to Frenchman's Street and catch cabs to everywhere. Perfect. Fabulous French restaurant on the same block. I loved this hotel. It was very affordable, comfortable and clean. It is not pretentious or fancy. It is a very nice 2 star hotel. Regular nice people working there. I loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: CJPWorthington
Reviews.Content: I just returned from New Orleans and stayed at this Best Western. It's far enough from Bourbon St. to be quiet but close enough to walk to everything in a short while. I felt completely safe in this area. I was traveling with my dad. We spent many hours in the courtyard by the pool. The staff was extra friendly. Our rooms were beautiful (newly renovated). We will definitely visit New Orleans again and we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay at this hotel agian.”
Reviews.Author: DKopp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night, 4 day anniversary trip to New Orleans. Booked this hotel for $169 for 3 nights through Expedia. Wasn't sure what to expect for the money, but was pleasantly surprised. We arrived before check in time and the hotel staff was very accommodating and checked us in early. The room was old, but clean. The bed was comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning, especially the "make your own" waffles. The location is 7 or 8 blocks from the riverfront, but we never took a cab, as we enjoyed the walk. Can't say enough about the staff. Very friendly and always accommodating. This place will be awsome when the renovations are complete. I'd definitely return. I've always had good experiences at Best Western Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Find out the things that they won't tell you.”
Reviews.Author: cajunbrwneyes
Reviews.Content: I went with my family July-16-18. I was so upset with the room.It was my first time getting away with my family.Money is tight so we have to save.I was excited to finally get away. We spoke with Tracy before leaving,she said she would match the price that we had at book it.com that two nights with tax would be 236.00.We loaded the card.Call before to pay,thought the room was paid.Got down there and found out about a 100.00 refundable deposit due.It would be given back at check out.Luckily we had it in cash.My prepaid card kept being declined cause they were trying to bill, room parking and 100.00 deposit.We were told just pay the 20.00 a day for parking in cash when u arrive.Also room had a smell.Half way through stay we found what it was a Rotten pizza from papa johns in the room closet in corner by safe.Still had pizza in it.Was very sad!The parking lot too VERY small! We drive a ford expedition,we were told first come first serve,if no parking then you have to go somewhere else.They park so tightly cause it's small area to park in.If it wasn't for someone that left next to us we wouldn't of got out of the spot.I It was an 8 or more block walk from the hotel to the river walk.We took a cab for half the trip. Average 11-13$ one way.Also they were Construction. noises.Also if you stay make sure to put Do not disturb on the door.If not House keeping will knock at 7 am,waking a late sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Needs cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Allablur
Reviews.Content: Dirty carpet, nasty brown bathroom grout, hair in bathroom on floor (not ours, we just walked into room), floors were horribly dirty, A/C stunk like cigarettes. Nice staff, but it needs a major overhaul. I booked it because of the good reviews, but the reality was a real bummer...

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mtiss
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to New Orleans and stayed at this BW several times on business and enjoyed our stay everytime, but this last stay was exceptional. When we checked in this last time there had been a mix up with our reservations but was fixed promptly taken to our rooms which were very clean and comfortable. Since we were going to be working out of the room for a week we requested some amenities (extra fridge and microwave) and they were moved into our room within 20 minutes, at no extra charge. The staff was quite accomodating as well as Gina in Sales. We would highly recommend this hotel as a "must stay" for any business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: rhondylee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from May 27-30, 2010, and selected the hotel because of the TripAdvisor photos as well as the location. The breakfast was alright, the usual pastries, juices, milk, coffee, cereal, toast, instant oatmeal, fruit, etc. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. If you stay at this hotel, be prepared to walk and walk to everything. Bourbon Street is three blocks and down by the river is over six blocks. Because of the heat and humidity, we ended up taking a cab to many locations. The mule carriage ride by Jackson Square is lovely (they don't use horses because of the high heat and humidity); you must try Cafe du Monde, but forget trying to get in at breakfast, the line is two blocks long. We went in the afternoon. For jazz, try Snug Harbor, the Spotted Cat or Apple Barrel. Before booking a hotel, I would definitely suggest mapping out what places you are wanting to see and then select your hotel accordingly...do you want a pool, a restaurant with your hotel, etc. The Natchez jazz lunch cruise is nice, as well as Cajun Tours Honey Island swamp tour. The area of this hotel is safe, we walked late at night and felt perfectly safe. This whole area of the French Quarter is active into the early morning hours, some bars are open 24/7. The street musicians are totally delightful and are very courteous about having their picture taken, but please remember to tip them. The French Market is like a giant outdoor flea market, but worthwhile to see. If you don't like heat and humidity, go earlier in the year and check the weather there prior. This hotel has internet access for printing out boarding passes or checking home email, which is definitely a plus. Many tours will pick you up at this hotel as well. I would definitely stay here again, though I would just remember to bring more money for cab fare!!

Reviews.Title: “I stayed here at the start of May 2010...”
Reviews.Author: Nobby1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the start of May 2010 whilst in town for a conference. The hotel is a pleasant 30 min walk through the French quarter to the EM convention centre and is very well situated for exploring the French Quarter itself. It sits on N. Rampart (which marks the northern perimeter of the French Quarter) directly opposite Louis Armstrong park. The street itself is a little run down but the heart of the tourist centre is only five minutes on foot and I felt safe walking to and from the hotel at all hours of the day and night. The room I stayed in was reasonable value, very clean, large and well appointed - couldn't really ask for more at the price. The communal areas of the hotel are a little more spartan and I didn't make use of the unattended bar or the pool. The breakfast is rubbish! Cereal/fruit is available along with unpleasant coffee, cheap muffins/pastries etc. I didn't bother after day one but you can find good eating anywhere in the FQ.
