Service otherwise was polite and efficient. The room was serviced daily (even when I spent all morning working in there) and always very clean. I'd stay here again if travelling for the same purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: zaria37
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel management must be listening, because I saw implrovements in all the areas commented on by the other reviewers on this site. The rooms were comfortable and clean, all the plumbing worked well, the continental breakfast was decent and fresh; the hot waffle maker was a nice touch, and the staff was constantly replenishing the food, and keeping up with the spiils. The hotel was as good as any Best Western i have stayed in in the past, and the staff was very helpful and professional. The two side streets take you quickly to Bourbon, and although quiet, were quite safe; I did not feel uncomfortable at any time. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: suzybelle3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!!!!!!! Perfect location. Three blocks away from bourbon street. Beautiful courtyard, jazz music playing while you relax by the pool. My room was very clean and the bed was the best I ever slept in. The staff were extremely helpful and kind. They made you feel very welcome. THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN NEW ORLEANS!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: JanetM37
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed bringing my travel group to New Orleans, and staying at the Best Western..the atmosphere was wonderful, and the decor a real reflection of this city, rich in ambience and history.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tishsilva
Reviews.Content: Very Nice spacious room with full sitting area, dining table and refrigerator/microwave sink! Very nice Bar Area and bartender! Just 3 blocks walking distance to Bourbon Street and Safe parking with iron Gates!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better....”
Reviews.Author: saxpilot
Reviews.Content: Ok, I read the reviews from other guests and I thought it was going to be nasty. It wasn't as bad as some reviewers said, and our room was actually pretty decent seeing as it was in the older section. One reviewer mentioned that it was an outer entrance hotel, "like an older motel" but that's just the architechture in NOLA. We liked the fact that there were balconys surrounding a courtyard, so I don't know what that reviewer was thinking. I will say the people working there were very nice and helpful. The walls are VERY thin. I could hear the guy in the room next to us cough and almost every word of his conversation on the phone. This I did not like. The elevators are small, two persons with luggage max. In terms of location, it's on the very outskirts of the quarter. I was a little nervous at night making the trek, as it is three blocks to Bourbon St. but they are very desolate and dark. There is a small store around the back right of the hotel that has soda, beer, snacks, etc. so that was convenient. So why did we stay there? It was free for us. We had built up points on one of my cards and Best Western gives you two for one. Otherwise, I would pick something closer to the action and a little newer/renovated. With the deals they're offering in NOLA right now, you could do better....

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jrobi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the FQ at least 15 times and this is by far the worst hotel that i have seen. When we checked in we were shown a room that faced out...like the old motel style. The room was was like a very very run down Motel 6. The pictures on the internet are of the "new" part of the hotel. There are only about 15 rooms in the new part....so good luck. However, when we were so grossed out by the room the staff moved us to the "new part". This was "acceptable" and seemed like a newer Motel 6. The breakfast was a bagel, weak coffee and cereal. The hotel is walking distance from the FQ but its on the outskirts and not in the best area of town. Don't be fooled by the pics and great reviews (not sure how they got those). A positive is that the staff are all very nice. They went out of the way to be friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MizzouLincoln
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Nov.1-5 and enjoyed our stay. The staff here are very accommodating. The first night we had a king room on the side facing Rampart Street and found it too noisy, so we asked for an inside king room, and they gave us one which was much quieter. They gave us good directions to sites to see, and helped book a Cajun Swamp Tour. I would highly recommend spending time witth Jake, the bartender, as he is not only an excellent bartender, but knows the area, and can recommend places to go, and restaurants to go to. The complimentary breakfast was fine,but could use a little more assortment of items. It is nice this hotel is a little off of Bourbon Street, as it can be a little wild. A couple of places we would recommend to eat at would be: The Gumbo Shop and Pierre Antoinne's.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Vieux CarrÃ© (French quarter), far enough from Bourbon street so you can sleep at night. Nice pool and inner court to relax before going out for dinner. Breakfast is good. Rooms (bathroom especially) could be cleaner, though. Fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Annlaughing
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed, the bed is usally a pillow top in all the Best Westerns I have stayed in this one wasn't. There was two spots on the carpet that my sock feet stuck too. The web page said it was recently updated, but they did a poor job of painting an ugly seem ran the length of one wall. The service was good, the breakfast was good and it was close to French Quarter. But for the money I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TacomaFPFAN
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for 4 days & stayed here. Though it is on the border of the French Quarters it was walking distance to all attractions. There is a small bar at the hotel with a bartender who is like a travel guide, he was great. One of the gals working night staff lives in the French Quarters & was also a great source of information. The walls were thin & breakfast was okay. Parking was $20/night. There is also a great little bar 2 blocks away called "Bar Tonique", I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the character.”
Reviews.Author: Aussietourists_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and is in a great spot, only 3 blocks from Bourbon Street. We arrived at 2am and the clerk was waiting for us with lots of information. He was very friendly. He directed us to a place to eat a few blocks away and told us about the cafe used in Benjamin Button movie. The heat knocked us about until we got into our air conditioned rooms and felt much better. We had adjoining rooms too, which was handy, even though our kids are adults. I would stay here again happily and will one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: pugpeace
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to meet our needs. We were able to get a fridge and microwave in our room. The room was nice and clean. First, our room was next to the elevator- yikes, I wasn't able to sleep the first night- I thought a train was passing over head. On our third night they were able to move us, and we slept just fine. The pool needs a cleaning, but we were happy to have access to it. The bartender was really friendly and gave us great advice. We paid 79$ a night and thought it was a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hollywooddan
Reviews.Content: I cant tell you how much we loved this place. The people are great.the place is beautifull. When you go there you must have a drink at the bar.Jake is the best and my wife and i loved him

Reviews.Title: “Chain hotel with French Quarter charm”
Reviews.Author: Keinika
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised to see a chain hotel like the Best Western have the same ambiance and charm of the historic French Quarter hotels nearby. In the middle of the property was this beautiful courtyard with a pool, tons of greenery, and a beautiful fountain. Downstairs across from the front desk was a cute little lounge that had a nicely stocked bar, piano, music playing over the speakers and an engaging bartender. Awesome hurricanes! The morning breakfast wasn't bad either. Cereals, bagels, fruit, eggs, pastries, coffee, tea, and juice was some of the fare. The only thing that I didn't like was the parking. Too tight and expensive. Staff was awesome at recommending restaurants and places to see. Good security at night.

Reviews.Title: “new years and sugar bowl”
Reviews.Author: capnfrog
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent. the room was smaller than expected as were the parking spaces. There was no ref.,shuttle service,data port, or newspaper. Overall I was satisfied. I had read some reviews that were not so good but mostly they were unfounded. My next trip to N.O. La. I will stay here again. The continental breakfast was very decent. Thanks again for an enjoyable 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: pebblelake
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, as planned, on my way back home from another trip. The staff throughout was amazing. The hotel is located in a old building but then again it is at the tip of the french quarter so that should be expected. The room I stayed in was really large with a comfortable king bed, eating table, office desk and chair, credenza and couch. It was outdated in its style but for the price and location, and short stays, this is a really great deal. The bathroom needs to be bleached down but there were more than enough clean towels and counter space with a small coffee maker for the supplied coffee and tea. They also have complimentary continental breakfast. It was too cold to use the terrace but it would be the perfect place for morning coffee and beignets. The location results in a quieter sleep but verify your surroundings before venturing.

Reviews.Title: “choose carefully”
Reviews.Author: mikebr0
Reviews.Content: best western on rampart is a decent clean hotel..i have stayed there several times in the past year or two...while some of the rooms are much nicer(newer) than others, i havent had any that were just horrible...i feel they are priced a little too high, but they usually always have availability...parking can be a problem if you drive a larger vehicle..they have there own nice secure well lit single level parking garage, but the spaces are very tight if you drive a full sized anything... very expensive to park...it cost me 65 dollars to park for 2 days, on top of the inflated room price...it was a special event weekend...so they claim(bayou classic)...the hotel is a few blocks away from the action on bourbon..i actually prefer that...all in all, i would stay there again...i am displeased with having to pay 65 dollars for 2 days of parking in a spot that i couldnt open my doors...had to unload bags and passengers and then back into the spot and squeeze out..lol

Reviews.Title: “run from this one”
Reviews.Author: marstep
Reviews.Content: do not stay at this hotel. the room was motel-6 or less standard. we were put clear in the back, and received no room service. we were told it was our fault for putting the "do not disturb" sign out. thing is, we did not, and when i told the clerk this she said we had to have or the room would be clean. she basically called me a liar. 3 block of dark streets to get to bourbon, not safe. i would never stay here again. we paid 198.00 for 2 nights, and this is what we received. we have stayed in best western many times and been very pleased, but BW should do something about this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IvyLeagueMd
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this hotel and in New Orleans. We stayed there this past weekend for the NBA ALLStar event and were plesantly surprised. Our room and the hotel itself was very clean. The staff were great and very helpful. We didn't have any problems walking back to the hotel from the French Quarter. I liked it because it was close to the action but far enough away from the action to get a lttle rest. I would reccomend it for buget minded travelers and will definitely stay there again the next time I visit New Orleans. And.........I will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't be a bargain at $49.99 per night!”
Reviews.Author: whowhome
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the BW in September 2006 for Jazz Fest 2007. The room we got (a double double #331) is the worst room I've ever stayed in in an American hotel! The paint was peeling, the door had to be lifted to fit into the door frame, the bathroom was tiny and dingy. My sister checked in a day later and got a room FOR THE SAME RATE in the new section. The quality of the room was a world apart from our room. If you stay at this BW, make sure to insist on the new section and try to get a room away from the street which is really noisy. Also, the hotel didn't have a bar - they were awaiting their post-Katrina license. One nice thing though - the courtyard was very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Basic New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasRos50
Reviews.Content: If you look around, you can see that the hotel suffered some damage from Katrina, but all seems to have been repaired. We stayed in one of the newer, recently repaired rooms which had central air instead of the usual Best Western air units. I have no complaints about this hotel. The staff was helpful and showed the usual New Orleans friendliness, the room was clean, the location was perfect for Jazz Fest. Had no trouble parking my car. The hotel is surrounded by people who live in the French Quarter and not tourist attractions, which I personally found favorable. I walked to and from the main part of the French Quarter many times without incident (I was concerned about this because of a previous review I had read). On the night we got in at 2:30 am, I took a cab which only cost $6 with the tip (coming from Canal Street). I consider this hotel 2 3/4 star place to stay. RR Houston, TX.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: themommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there to get away from the kids for a night. We live near Baton Rouge. I booked it because the price was so cheap and it was in the FQ and it was Best Western so I knew there would be some quality standards. The hotel is still recovering post-Katrina. The street it's on was eerily deserted. So although we were aware to be careful of street crime, there was no one on the streets. The room although very small was nicely renovated from top to bottom. All new furniture, carpet, drapes, bathroom fixtures, etc., nice big TV. The biggest problem was no restaurant, no bar (still being renovated), the ice machines were broken and the soft drink machine is all the way down in the parking lot. The pool was clean. The guests at the hotel were decent. The staff was nice. My husband and I strolled the outside balcony on the third floor which gives you an inside view of the properties surrounding the hotel, that's when you realize despite the present outward appearances, this is not a poor neighborhood. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm suprised at the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: okiefolks
Reviews.Content: I was really suprised to see all the bad reviews of this hotel. My husband and I stayed there a week in March to celebrate our third anniversary. We thought it was a great bargin. It was one of the cheapest hotels I could find near the French Quarter. Our room was clean, the air was cold, and the staff was very frindly. Our room was cleaned early every day, and we had plenty of towels, soap, etc. The staff was very helpful with tour information, directions, and resturaunt reccommendations. We also met some great friends in the little pub in the hotel. We walked to Bourbon Street every night, and came back late every night, and we never had any problems (other than a few bums asking for change, but that happens everywhere). I would reccommend this hotel to any budget minded travelers. As others have said, you get what you pay for. Don't expect a 5 star hotel for $70 a night. Overall our stay at this hotel was a great experince.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: kristen3218
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed here 6/1-6/4. It was our 1st time in New Orleans. I was very nervous to stay here because I had heard good & bad. We loved the shuttle service. While I was here, we had no problem getting on & off the shuttle at the times we wanted. I thought for the first time visiting NO the shuttle was perfect. We were able to experience the French Quarter, but able to get away. I thought 8:20 return time was a bit early at 1st, but it actually worked out perfectly. We were able to get back to the hotel & get some sleep before another long day. I thought the hotel was very clean, they replaced the towels & cleaned every day we were there. Hotel staff was very friendly & helpful. We only paid $49.95 a night, and for the price the Best Western more than exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base for French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: irlrobins
Reviews.Content: Perfect for exploring French Quarter. Only a few mins walk from Bourbon St. Perfectly safe to walk from hotel to the strip at night. Even if you do bump into a few drag queens heading to the gay bar on the corner. Room was clean and in good nick. Not much of a view, but thats the french quarter. Good sized TV, not that you'll have time to use it. Bathroom was a lil small but clean and shower had good pressure. Staff were helpful giving directions (Thanks Wayne!). Not the fanciest of places, but it is perfect for a budget break for those who want to see N'Awlins at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 7 day sojourn in the French Quarter, with this hotel as our base. Without fail, every person there was friendly, courteous, helpful and gracious. The hotel itself is wonderful! Small, quaint, historic. The rooms were very clean and nice and cool. The courtyard with pool was definitely an oasis of peace and tranquility. There were four in our party and each of us thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. I would not hesitate to return nor would I hesitate to recommend this place to anyone destined for N'Awlins!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Roseperia
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the bad reviews about this place. My and husbend and I stayed here for two nights and we thought it was great. When you first get there the outside does fool you, it looks worn. But the inside is very nice. My room was a good size and it was nice and clean. It wasn't perfect but who cares. You go on vacation to see the city not the inside of your hotel room. Its only three blocks from Burbon St so your actually paying for the conveniance of the short distance. As for the elevators, they are small and sometimes don't work but the stairs are right next to it and it's only 2 small flights. And the staff is super nice and very helpfull. All and all this hotel was a great experiance for us and when we go back, unless it's booked up, we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would think twice before staying again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There was a group of 6 of us going for a quick weekend , My Husbund & I have been to NO before but frist time for rest. We rented 2 rooms, Our room was good size and clean, we had a problem getting the air to work even after personal came to fix it it still didn't cool off. Used the ceiling fan, still very hot and suffy windows didn't open. Our Son and girlfrinds room alot smaller and they had the opposite problem they couldn't get air to shut off. Room got very cold. The elevetor is a hoot! 3 people and luggage is a effort but hey the place was build in the 1800's . The staff was all very professional and helpful, the buffet breakfast very good and cheap $6.50 . Hot and cold very bontiful. Our biggest drawback was the distance to Burbon not a bad walk but it is a distance. We stayed here because the price was within the others traveling with us on a tight budget. We all agreed that it would have been better off spending a little more for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable and homey - the courtyard definitely added character and a great place to sit and have a drink or coffee. Highly recommend a room overlooking the courtyard versus the parking lot or street. It's not the Ritz, but a warm place to go back to after a long day. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. I'd go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Not in the best location but nice.”
Reviews.Author: wonderlandprincess83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and must say it is a long scary walk from the heart of the French Quarter to the property at night. It is still considered in the French Quarter, but on the very outskirts. It was a nice best western and has a pretty fountain in the courtyard. The man at the front desk (didn't get his name) very gentle and accommodating to all our needs. I wish it were a little bit closer to Jackson square of Bourbon street, but you get what you pay for. Good rates. Bad location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: watthe
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last week for 3 nights and I wouldn't really recommend it. We had been travelling in the USA for almost a month and had had a great time. When we arrived at this hotel we were allocated a room right down the back of the hotel on the 2nd level. The lift was very small and kept closing on us as we tried to get in. We got to the room and it was a smokers room, there was no way we could stay in it. I rang the front desk only to be told that was all that was available, they were no help at all. I then rang them back and told them that I suffered allergies and I needed another room. I was then given a non smoking room but it was small and dingy. They charged $1.65 per day for the safe even if you didn't use it. I would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Shame About the Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well... I'm glad to see it wasn't just us who had a bad time! We stayed in Sept. 2003 and had several problems with the staff. The cleaners "lost" some of our clothes whilst tidying the room and then nobody could find them. After two days of excuses, I spoke with the Manager who told me to write a complaint to Best Western! Strangely, when I told him that I was going to involve the Police, our missing clothes just re-appeared within an hour... The hotel itself is on the edge of the French Quarter, but that's not such a bad thing and the courtyard is nice... but the staff still managed to make us feel unwelcome.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I was warned in time....”
Reviews.Author: CarolVBrady
Reviews.Content: Just to say that I'm glad I visited this site! My husband and I, who are coming to NO (and the States!) for the first time ever next March, were going to book this hotel on the strength of the info/pictures on the web. Also, we were advised that Best Western hotels were usually of a good standard, so thought it would be ok. Our second choice was the Maison St Charles (as a back-up), but after reading reviews of both, cancelled the Landmark and booked the M St C. Hope things turn out ok, especially as we've saved for ages to go on this trip!! Also hope that the Landmark's management reads these reviews and does something about the obvious problems with what appears to be beautiful accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel is not an ideal location...some 8-12 blocks to the major sites (a long walk on a hot New Orleans summer day). During my stay, there were constant interruptions from the staff because of cable being installed in the rooms. Several times, workers knocked on my door attempting to gain entry. The construction also blocked my exit several times. When I complained to the manager, nothing was done and my complaint was made to seem trivial. The hotel restaurant is awful. Don't even bother with it for the quick breakfast buffet. I give the hotel an "extra" star because I did enjoy sitting in the courtyard area next to the pool otherwise this is strictly a one star review because of poor service and less than ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Looks are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The internet site looks lovely and relaxing, but anxiety set in after reading other reviews. Since they were several months old I hoped for improvement. The location is on the outer edge of the French Quarter with inadequate crowded parking, I had to park several blocks away. Check-in was fine, but the elevator held only 2 people at a time, with 1 bag each. I had expected to overlook the charming water fountain square per the internet description, but instead overlooked a parking lot and was advised that it would be another $20 per night to overlook a nicer view but there were none available. The room was small and crowded with a poorly added bathroom...there was a bump up seam that I tripped on getting to the bathroom and the closet door wouldn't close. The hotel room door required a wrestling match to open from inside or out. Needless to say, I cancelled the balance of my reservation and changed hotels. Do yourself a favor and stay clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from May 13th to the 17th. It was nice overall,nice rooms, nice pool. However, we did have to wait until 3:00 to check in, they didnt let us in earlier, but did secure our bags. Pete the bellman and all around good guy will give you good advice and drop you at locations w/the shuttle, which at times was a plus. The location to the French Quarter was close, but EVERYONE told us (especially since we were girls) not to walk back to the hotel after dark. Although it didnt seem bad, everyone said the same thing, rather than risk it, we took a $5 taxi ride. Overall, I recommend it, the price was good and the location was good if you dont mind taking a taxi back, or if you're guys, you dont have to worry (not as much anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What should have been a great honeymoon went horribly wrong. The room was not ready until 5 PM when they promised us 2 PM and ---- hold your hat --- there was a dead rat in the toilet! The front desk people didn't care and the manager said "Its the Quarter, we can't help it!" We went next door to the Olde Victorian Inn and had a great stay in a room with a private balcony and a great view.

Reviews.Title: “My second Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to New Orleans with a group for Mardi Gras which has a thiry year history of visits, 25 or so of them with the Landmark. The location is superb, the staff friendly and efficient. I especially love the personal interaction. The staff makes you feel wanted and at home. Once when I was ill, one of them even offered to care for me. The management always appreciates our visits; we feel a kinship with the place. It is a second home, of which I whole heartedly recommend. For all my New Orleans visits, Mardi Gras or not, it is always "Cabbie, 920 North Rampart, The Landmark!"

Reviews.Title: “Problems all Around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Landmark has a lot of work to do to become hospitable and/or habitable. Our first major problem was with the bathtub. In wouldn't drain. The 2nd person taking a shower was forced to stand in a foot-and-half of dirty water. We complained. Someone came, made a complete mess of the tub, and still it didn't drain. I wound up cleaning black shards of goo out of the tub and swore I'd never stay at a Best Western hotel again. Then there was the TV. Three bands of color from left to right so that a car changed from blue to green to red as it drove across the screen. The excercise room smelled so strongly of chlorine that I thought I would pass out just walking by. We were told the wrong time for breakfast by the front desk and consequently missed it. We arranged with the front desk for a taxi to take us to the airport but, surprise, no taxi. I have written a letter of complaint to Best Western but, alas, as of 8 months later, have received no reply.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS French Quarter Landmark Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 920 N Rampart Street, New Orleans, LA 70116
